title: Errors in "Be careful when interpreting predictive models in search of causal insights"
body:
Hi, I'm reading the documentation, and the page for "Be careful when interpreting predictive models in search of causal insights" does not show images. Therefore, I am running the code on an instance of Google Colab, but I am finding errors. The first one happens at block  [3]

`clust = shap.utils.hclust(X, y, linkage="single")`

raises `Exception: Unknown linkage: single` and `WARNING: [...] reg:linear is now deprecated in favor of reg:squarederror.`

Removing the `linkage `parameter allows me to continue, until block [6], where the last line

`shap.plots.scatter(shap_values, ylabel="SHAP value\n(higher means more likely to renew)", overlay={
    "True causal effects": marginal_effects(generator, 10000, X.columns)
})`

also fails (`TypeError: scatter() got an unexpected keyword argument 'ylabel'`).

It may be that this notebook is using an older version of SHAP, but it is not specified which.

Also clicking on the "Edit on GitHub" button results in a 404 error.
